docs.lead_paragraph: FOR as long as the vaccine for Hepatitis B has been in general use, some parents have been fighting it. Now it is New Jersey's turn.

headline.main: A Skirmish Over the Hepatitis B Vaccination

docs.abstract: Article on battle between New Jersey legislature and state Health Department over bill that would mandate Hepatitis B vaccinations for all school age children and amendment that would have given parents option of refusing; photo (M)
docs.snippet: FOR as long as the vaccine for Hepatitis B has been in general use, some parents have been fighting it.    Now it is New Jersey's turn.

docs.lead_paragraph: Stepping up his attack on Republican tax-cutting proposals, President Clinton said today that the cost of the tax bill moving through the House would rise to unimaginable levels and threaten the nation's ability to deal with its most pressing long-term problems. Citing a new estimate by the Treasury Department that the cost of the House tax bill would ''explode'' from $864 billion over the first decade to $3 trillion in the 10-year period starting in 2010, Mr. Clinton said the country could not afford to allocate anywhere near that much money to tax cuts without first shoring up Social Security and Medicare.

headline.main: Clinton Warns Against G.O.P.'s Tax Cuts

keywords.value: HEALTH MAINTENANCE ORGANIZATIONS AND MANAGED CARE

docs.lead_paragraph: AT the age of 59, Marcia Tucker is bidding farewell to the New Museum of Contemporary Art in her usual style. Her swan song at the museum she single-handedly founded 22 years ago is ''The Time of Our Lives,'' an exhibition that is characteristically personal, topical, rough around the edges and intent on raising consciousness. Alternately sappy and insightful, this exhibition ignores most esthetic issues and instead brings together a broad array of art and artifacts -- from paintings to television commercials -- pertaining to a complex human and social theme: growing old. The result is less an art exhibition than a multifaceted learning experience; therein lie its weaknesses as well as its intermittent strengths.

headline.main: An Ode To Old Age, Life's Gift

docs.abstract: Roberta Smith reviews exhibit The Time of Our Lives at New Museum of Contemporary Art; photos; show is last arranged by Marcia Tucker, who is leaving museum she founded 22 years ago (M)
